summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: How does the city sit solitary, that was full of people! The great one among the nations is become as a widow; the princess of provinces is become tributary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She weeps sore in the night, and her tears are on her cheeks; among all her lovers she has none to comfort her; all her friends have dealt treacherously with her; they are become her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah is gone into captivity because of the affliction and because of the greatness of the servitude; she dwells among the Gentiles; she finds no rest; all her persecutors overtook her between the straits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The streets of Zion mourn because there are none to come to the solemnities; all her gates are destroyed; her priests sigh, her virgins are afflicted, and she is in bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her enemies have been made the head; those who hated her have been prospered; for the LORD has afflicted her for the multitude of her rebellions; her children are gone into captivity before the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the daughter of Zion all her beauty is departed; her princes are become like harts that find no pasture, and they are gone without strength before the pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem remembered the days of her affliction and of her rebellions and of all her desirable things that she had in the times of old when her people fell into the hand of the enemy, and no one helped her; the enemies saw her and mocked at her days of rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem has grievously sinned; therefore she is removed; all that honoured her despise her because they have seen her nakedness; yea, she sighs and is turned backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her filthiness is in her skirts; she did not remember her latter end; therefore she came down surprisingly; she has no comforter. O LORD, behold my affliction, for the enemy has magnified himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy has spread out his hand upon all her precious things, and she saw the Gentiles enter into her sanctuary, whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thy congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All her people sought their bread with sadness; they have given all their precious things for food to maintain life; see, O LORD, and consider, for I am become vile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by? behold, and see if there is any sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is come unto me because the LORD has afflicted me in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From upon high he has sent fire into my bones, and it prevails against them; he has spread a net for my feet; he has turned me back; he has made me desolate and always with pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The yoke of my rebellions is bound in his hand; they are wreathed and come up upon my neck; he has made my strength to fall; the Lord has delivered me into their hands, from whom I am not able to rise up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has trodden under foot all my mighty men in the midst of me; he has called a company against me to crush my young men; the Lord has trodden the virgin daughter of Judah as in a winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things I weep; my eyes, my eyes stream with water because the comforter that gives rest unto my soul has left me; my sons are desolate because the enemy prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zion spread forth her hands and has no comforter; the LORD gave a commandment against Jacob that his enemies should besiege him; Jerusalem was an abomination in the midst of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is righteous, for I have rebelled against his mouth; hear now, all the peoples and see my sorrow; my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called unto my lovers, but they have deceived me; my priests and my elders in the city perished seeking food to maintain their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, O LORD; for I am in distress; my bowels are troubled; my heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled; abroad the sword bereaves; at home there is as death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have heard that I sigh; and there is no comforter for me; all my enemies have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast done it. Thou hast brought the day that thou hast spoken of, but they shall be like unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let all their wickedness come before thee; and do unto them as thou hast done unto me for all my rebellions; for my sighs are many, and my heart is filled with pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How has the Lord darkened the daughter of Zion in his anger! He has cast down from heaven unto the earth the beauty of Israel and not remembered his footstool in the day of his anger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has destroyed and has not forgiven; he has destroyed in his wrath all the habitations of Jacob; he has thrown down to the ground the strong holds of the daughter of Judah; he has polluted the kingdom and its princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has cut off in his fierce anger all the horn of Israel; he has caused his right hand to draw back in the presence of the enemy, and he burned in Jacob like a flaming fire, which devours round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has bent his bow like an enemy; he strengthened his right hand as an adversary and slew everything of beauty that could be seen in the tent of the daughter of Zion; he poured out his fury like fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was as an enemy, he has destroyed Israel; he has destroyed all her palaces; he has dissipated his strong holds and has multiplied in the daughter of Judah mourning and lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has violently taken away his tabernacle as if it were of a garden; he has destroyed his congregation; the LORD has caused the solemnities and sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion and has rejected in the indignation of his anger the king and the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has cast off his altar; he has abhorred his sanctuary; he has given up into the hand of the enemy the walls of her palaces; they have shouted in the house of the LORD as in the day of a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD has purposed to destroy the wall of the daughter of Zion; he has stretched out the line; he has not withdrawn his hand from destroying; therefore he made the rampart and the wall to lament; they were destroyed together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her gates were thrown to the ground; he has destroyed and broken her bars; her king and her princes are carried off among the Gentiles; there is no law; nor have her prophets found vision from the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of the daughter of Zion sat upon the ground and are silent: they have cast up dust upon their heads; they have girded themselves with sackcloth; the daughters of Jerusalem hung their heads down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes fail with tears; my bowels are troubled; my liver is poured upon the earth, for the destruction of the daughter of my people because the children and the sucklings faint in the streets of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to their mothers, Where is the wheat and the wine? fainting as the dead in the streets of the city, pouring out their souls into their mothers’ bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What witness shall I take to thee? Or unto whom shall I liken thee, O daughter of Jerusalem? Unto whom shall I compare thee, that I may comfort thee, O virgin daughter of Zion? for thy breach is as great as the sea: who shall heal thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy prophets have preached vanity and foolishness unto thee; and they have not uncovered thine iniquity to turn away thy captivity but have preached unto thee vain prophecies and digressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that passed by clapped their hands over thee and whistled and wagged their heads over the daughter of Jerusalem, saying, Is this the city that men called The perfection of beauty, The joy of the whole earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All thine enemies opened their mouths regarding thee; they whistled and gnashed their teeth; they said, Swallow her up; certainly this is the day that we looked for; we have found it, we have seen it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD has done that which he had determined; he has fulfilled his word that he had commanded from the time of old; he has destroyed and has not forgiven; and he has caused thine enemy to rejoice over thee; he has raised up the horn of thine adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tsade Their heart cried unto the Lord, O wall of the daughter of Zion; let tears run down like a river day and night; give thyself no rest; let not the apple of thine eye cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, cry out in the night; in the beginning of the watches; pour out thine heart like water before the face of the Lord; lift up thy hands toward him for the life of thy young children that faint for hunger in the top of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, O LORD, and consider unto whom thou hast shaken thus. Shall the women eat their fruit, the little ones that they are bringing up? shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuary of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young and the old lay on the ground in the streets; my virgins and my young men fell by the sword; thou hast slain them in the day of thine anger; thou hast killed and hast not forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast called as to a day of solemnity my terrors from everywhere, so that in the day of the LORD’s anger no one escaped nor remained: those that I have swaddled and brought up my enemy has consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am a man that sees affliction in the rod of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has led me and brought me into darkness, but not into light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely he is turned against me; he turns his hand against me all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh and my skin he has made old; he has broken my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has built against me and compassed me with gall and travail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has set me in dark places as those that are dead for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has hedged me about that I cannot get out; he has made my chain heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when I cried and shouted, he shut out my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has enclosed my ways with hewn stone; he has made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait and as a lion in secret places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has made my ways crooked and pulled me in pieces; he has made me desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has bent his bow and set me as a mark for the arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my kidneys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a derision to all my people and their song every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled me with bitterness, he has made me drunk with wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has broken my teeth with gravel stones; he has covered me with ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul removed itself far from peace; I forgot about good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, My strength and my hope of the LORD is perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember my affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul shall have them still in remembrance because it is humbled in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall go down into my heart; therefore I shall wait.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is of the LORD’s mercies that we are not consumed because his mercies never diminish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are new every morning; great is thy faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore I will wait for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is good unto those that wait in him, to the soul that seeks him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good to wait quietly in the salvation of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is good for the man if he bears the yoke from his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall sit alone and keep silence because he has borne it upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall put his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall turn his cheek unto him that smites him; he shall be filled with reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But though he causes grief, yet he will also have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he does not afflict nor grieve the sons of men from his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord does not approve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mem Who shall he be that saith that something comes which the Lord has not sent?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceeds not evil and good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why does the living man have pain, the man in his sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us search out our ways, and seek, and turn again to the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have rebelled and been disloyal; therefore thou hast not forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast unfurled anger and persecuted us; thou hast slain, thou hast not forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud that our prayer should not pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and abomination in the midst of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes stream with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes run down, and cease not, for there is no relief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until the LORD looks down, and beholds from the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes make my soul sad because of all the daughters of my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My enemies hunted me like a bird, without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They bound up my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Waters flowed over my head; then I said, I am dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast heard my voice; do not hide thine ear at my cry that I might breath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee; thou didst say, Fear not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the cause of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O LORD, thou hast seen where I was wrong; plead thou my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of those that rose up against me, and their design against me all the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Render unto them a recompense, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them sorrow of heart; thy curse unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Persecute them in thy anger and cut them off from under the heavens, oh LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are scattered through the crossings of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zion, precious and esteemed more than pure gold, how are they taken for earthen vessels, the work of the hands of the potter!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the sea monsters draw out the breast; they give suck to their young ones; the daughter of my people is cruel like the ostriches in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tongue of the sucking child cleaves to the roof of his mouth for thirst; the young children ask for bread, and there was no one to break it unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those that did feed delicately are made desolate in the streets; those that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people has increased more than the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment, and companies did not camp upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her Nazarites were whiter than snow; they were more radiant than milk; their composure had more fire than the precious stones cut from sapphire:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their visage is blacker than a coal; they are not known in the streets; their skin cleaves to their bones; it is withered; it is dry like a stick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those slain with the sword are better than those slain with hunger; for these pine away, stricken through for want of the fruits of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hands of the compassionate women have cooked their own children; they were their food in the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD has accomplished his fury; he has poured out his fierce anger and has kindled a fire in Zion, and it has devoured the foundations thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth and all the inhabitants of the world never believed that the adversary and the enemy would enter in through the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mem For the sins of her prophets and the iniquities of her priests, that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have wandered blindly in the streets; they were polluted in blood, so that no one could touch their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cried unto them, Depart ye; it is unclean; depart, depart, touch not because they were contaminated; and when they were thrust through, they said among the Gentiles, They shall never dwell here again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anger of the LORD has separated them; he will never look upon them again. They did not respect the countenance of the priests, nor did they have compassion on the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for us, our eyes have failed in seeking our vain help; in our watching we have watched for people that cannot save us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hunt our steps that we cannot walk in our streets; our end came near; our days were fulfilled; for our end is come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our persecutors were swifter than the eagles of the heaven; they pursued us upon the mountains; they laid wait for us in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the LORD, was taken in their pits, of whom we had said, Under his shadow we shall live among the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Schin Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom that dwellest in the land of Uz; the cup shall also pass even unto thee; thou shalt be drunken and shalt vomit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will never cause thee to be carried away again; he will visit thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom; he will uncover thy sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us; look, and behold our reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are orphans without father; our mothers are as widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have drunk our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our necks are under persecution; we are become tired and have no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have given the hand to the Egyptians and to the Assyrians to be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers have sinned and are dead; and we have borne their chastisements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaves have ruled over us: there was no one to deliver us out of their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We got our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our skin became black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ravished the women in Zion and the virgins in the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Princes were hanged up by their hand; the countenance of the elders was not honoured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crown is fallen from our head; woe now unto us, for we have sinned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this our heart is saddened; for these things our eyes are become dim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou, O LORD, shall remain for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should thou forget us for ever and forsake us for such a long time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn us unto thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in stepping back thou hast rejected us; thou hast become very angry against us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
